alert.note: Alert for Boone; Logan; Northwest Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Heavy showers will impact portions of northwestern Raleigh, east central Logan, north central Wyoming and southeastern Boone Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 840 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy showers along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Wharton to near Logan. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down trees in saturated soils, and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oceana, Amherstdale-Robinette, Wharton, Bald Knob, Bradley, Mallory, Whitesville, Sylvester, Cyclone, Naoma, Arnett, Dorothy, Kopperston, Stickney, Blair, Amherstdale-Robine and Bolt. This includes West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 49 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding given the saturated conditions from all the rain this week. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
